intro: Ribes colandina, commonly known as the Canadian gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to North America. It belongs to the genus Ribes in the family Grossulariaceae, which includes other species of currants and gooseberries. The plant produces small, yellow to orange berries that are edible and often used in jams and preserves. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have serrated edges, while its stems are hairy and reddish in color. Ribes colandina thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks.
